intro: Cracca gracilipes, commonly known as the slender cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal due to its graceful appearance. Cracca gracilipes is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
